intro: Epilobium lanceolatum f. umbrosum, commonly known as the shade-loving willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces small, pink to purple flowers clustered in elongated inflorescences. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in disturbed soils or along the edges of shaded habitats. This subspecies is noted for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions, making it a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
